meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>deliver</kanji> so the verb vocab version here is <vocabulary>to be delivered</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to arrive</vocabulary>. You know this one is "to be delivered" (aka it's just getting delivered, you aren't doing the delivery) because when this item arrives at your house you say "<reading>coo'</reading>" (く), it arrived.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the one you learned with the kanji: とど!
